Tutorial.description: Explains the advanced build mode tools

Start.Content: Welcome to the Advanced Building Tutorial! Here you will learn how to use the tools to make building a lot faster and easier

StateA.Content: You can only access the advanced building mode in a ship core or build block.

StateB.Content: The first useful feature is the left shift button, It will let you move a lot faster (as opposed to slower in astronaut mode).

StateC.Content: While in build mode, hold down $BUILD_MODE_FIX_CAM to activate the advanced build mode. You will see several options on the right side of your screen.

StateD.Content: While holding $BUILD_MODE_FIX_CAM , you can place/remove blocks by directly clicking on blocks with your mouse cursor. Each tool will now be explained...

StateE.Content: Remove mode turns the yellow build box into a red one that shows you what blocks are going to be removed. This is especially helpful for removing larger areas.

StateF.Content: Lighten mode removes any shadows and shading from the blocks, lighting up dark areas to make it easier to see when building. Keep in mind to disable it once in a while to see how good your ship looks with lighting enabled.

StateG.Content: The three sliders are one of the best tools for building. They will increase the build area so multiple blocks can be build/removed at once. Servers have different max settings, and you can set them for your single player game in the server.cfg file.

StateG1.Content:
Orientation is available if a rotatable block is selected. Those blocks are either blocks with individual sides or special shapes like wedges.
You can also rotate through the block orientations with the mouse wheel while holding $BUILD_MODE_FIX_CAM

StateH.Content:
Whenever you accidentally misplaced or deleted a block, you can undo your last actions by clicking on 'undo'.
You can also redo by clicking on 'redo'.

StateI.Content: Copy/paste lets you select an area and paste it, providing you have the required blocks. Click on "copy" and then select the area to copy then click on paste to place it down again. Connections will be copied if the controller and controlled blocks are both in the copied area.

Symmetry planes are probably the best tools in the game. You place down 'walls' that divide your structure in parts. Placing a block on one side will also place the block on the other side. 'odd' symmetry just lets you move the wall to the middle of a block. You can use multiple symmetry planes to maximize your building speed.

StateJ.Content: Mirror mode basically just tells symmetry mode to also mirror blocks that can be orientated like weapons, etc...

StateK.Content:
The remove filter is a great tool to quickly refit your ship! You can select a block from the drop down menu (or use the filter above to search for specific names) and only the selected block will be removed when right clicking.
This works with larger build areas and symmetry.

End.Content: This concludes the Advanced Build Tutorial. Thanks for reading, and thanks for playing StarMade!
